channel.title: Docs on MockK Guidebook
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on MockK Guidebook

item.description: Android Quickstart # MockK works great with Android and allows you to mock objects in both your Android unit tests and instrumented tests. MockK can handle mocking Context, static functions, and more to help you test your Android code. To install MockK, all you need to do is add it as a dependency in your module’s Gradle file. In most Android Studio projects, this file is located at app/build.gradle. Once you open the file, search for the dependencies block and add a new line.
